title: Great practice
body:
The building was very impressive, clean and tidy.
The technician was very pleasant and helpful.
Office staff always helpful.

title: Good review
body: My medication was reviewed by a telephone appointment with someone from the pharmacy team.They were very well informed and were able to ask good questions and took action. I have an appointment to have my blood pressure taken on Monday. Very efficient and reliable service.

title: Great service for a newly registered patient
body: As a carer for a family member I was impressed with the service I received whilst in a panic.  The nurse from the prescribing team talked me through the main symptoms and side effects and arranged for one of the GPs to ring me in the morning.  The GP was caring and efficient, ringing back after consulting with a AED consultant, arranging tests later that morning and then a lengthy face to face consultation, liaising with the pharmacist and arranging a 2 week follow up.  The HCA who carried out the ECG and blood tests was also extremely caring and professional.  An all round impressive service from reception to pharmacy.  Well done and thank you.

title: Best practice by far
body:
This practice has goes above and beyond all of the time .
The receptionists always try and help to get you an appointment on the day . The doctors always go above and beyond to help you when your in need . The whole team , listen , care and always want to help . I have been with this practice for 40 years . 
It is extremely clean and tidy .

title: Problematic
body: Unfortunately the surgery does not seem to see itself as part of the community. Its staff do their best to stop discussions about improving it. The practice manager (is there one?) wont return calls and no one will give you their name. Most of the staff are part time so there is no continuity of care. It could (and has been) great. Now its very sterile (atmospherically) and sad

title: Change my life
body: I am a 50 year old male struggling with depression and anxiety problems my  doctor diagnosed me with male menopause which I’ve never heard off I thought it was a woman problem I was wrong.He advised me to have a testosterone test best thing I have ever done a simple blood test I had low testosterone with help from gp who prescribed Me a prescription my levels have gone up I feel like a new man the surgery from start to finish have really helped me out and the doctor I dealt with was great

title: Lovely practice
body: In the past few months, I have visited this practice a few times for myself and my children. I never have issues getting appointments, and the receptionists are always friendly and professional. They don't get the credit they deserve. I have seen GP's and a lovely nurse. They are always thorough and friendly. My children love the nurse, she has done their jabs and always makes it a relaxing environment. Very glad we have this practice. Thanks to all at Warwick Road Surgery.

title: Great experience of Children's A&E
body:
I brought my non-speaking autistic son to Children's A&E on an evening in Feb 2023. Every staff member we came across was brilliant. Especially the lovely nurse who helped me pick a dvd for my son to watch; you were so lovely and understanding of him. Also thanks to the radiology staff cheering my son on after his x-ray. He loves the sticker he got.
Every staff member shows why the NHS is great and we appreciate what you do.

title: Excellent care
body:
I had cataracts removed, one on 8th October 2022 and the other on 16th December. The care was superb, the preparation for each operation was explained at each stage and nothing was too much trouble for any member of staff, even down to checking that I had a drink of water when needed. I felt nothing during the operation, though I was awake all the time.
I was given a pack before I left and everything in it was carefully explained (use of the eye drops provided, other instructions, etc).
After the first operation, I was advised to get reading glasses and sun glasses to help as adjustment progressed. I had been warned that my near sight could not be retrieved. I could perhaps have done with a little more advice about seeing with now two such different types of sight, though it was suggested that the lens from my then every-day glasses be removed as that first eye was seeing so very much sharper and better by itself. This helped a lot.
The exciting part, after the operations and after the gritty feeling in the eyes had gone, has been seeing colours much more brilliantly and outlines to things, especially farther away, which had before been blurred and with indistinct edges.
A huge thankyou and hundreds of stars to all at SpaMedica for such a miraculous change in my life!

title: Lottery
body:
I was visiting Blackpool looking after my mother. Out of curiosity I took a Blood Pressure test. It was quite high.
My GP was 250 miles, away, so I went to this NHS Walk-in centre. I had a short wait, saw a GP and was prescribed BP medication. He advised me that to come back if after 10 days if my BP was still high. 10 days my later BP was still high so I returned. This time I was seen by a nurse.
She told me to a local GP and register as a visitor. It was Friday afternoon, which left me with a weekend of worry of having a heart attack or stroke.

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body:
The surgery at Elvington has, in my opinion, a fantastic structure, that is fit for purpose and strikes the right balance between acute and routine appointments. 

For acute problems, my family has always been seen the same day. Just today, my son came home from school with an acute issue and even calling the survey at 16:15, a GP saw him before 18:00. 

It is a great example of how things can be done. If there is common sense by both surgery and patient, everyone can have their needs attending to in an appropriate way.

Thank you, and keep up the great work!

title: Aftercare
body:
:  I attended day case for a carpal tunnel release procedure. Was given a discharge letter with special requirements which where all to be done by myself no follow up or aftercare at all. 
After following the advice and removing my bandage, I discovered the dressing full of blood. I contacted the number on the discharge letter only to be put through to a number of departments! Finally got to speak to someone in the treatment room. 
I was advised to come to see them there and then. The ladies there senior health care assistants was a breath of fresh air and a credit to the hospital. They fixed me up and answered all my concerns, the also pointed out my stitches would need removing where I’d been told they would dissolve!!!
It’s not only the care whilst having a procedure it’s the aftercare given as well. 
Extremely disappointed at the aftercare or none that I have received apart from the lovely ladies in the treatment room.

title: Practice managed terribly
body:
This used to be a great practice but they seem to have a high admin turnover and each member of staff seems to be more unhelpful than the last. My last telephone calls with them were rude, unprofessional and incredibly unhelpful. They also still do not see patients with Covid no matter the situation or how vulnerable the patient is whereas many other practices just put measures in place to allow them to do this. 

The practice is not run well and they do not book face to face visits, you instead need to go through a telephone visit first. If it’s something that needs to be seen or listened to such as a rash, a lump or suspected breathing complications (which you’ve already explained to the receptionist) they will still book a telephone appointment first. If this is to save time it only wastes everyone’s time. The receptionist always asks why you need to see the Dr but there doesn’t seem to be any triaging here like there is at other practices or like they used to do prior to Covid. Rather than offering a face to face for something urgent and important but not yet an emergency they will advise you to go to an urgent care centre or A&E to have a face to face appointment instead although it is not an emergency and that is not what those services are for. 

A couple of the Drs here are fantastic but they also have many Drs and nurses who come and go (possibly locums) who are terrible and have given me personally conflicting and scarily incorrect information and advice. 

If you aren’t happy with the service you can complain to the Practice Manager, however whenever I am physically in the Drs surgery the receptionist is always on the phone telling someone they can complain to the Practice Manager or that the Practice Manager will call them back. However, looking at the reviews here the surgery is stating that they take the care of their patients seriously and ask reviewers to contact the Practice Manager to discuss the issue. This standard template response further impounds that the surgery do not care about their patients. I am sure this review will get the same or similar response. 

There seem to be a lot of reviews on here about the telephone system, this has been a problem going back years. The surgery are aware of the issues but do not rectify it which is so frustrating when you have to keep calling the surgery 100 times at 8am if you want any hope of an appointment. You also cannot book future appointments, they only offer same day and either morning or afternoon so you wait by the phone all day. If you miss the call you’ve missed your chance, they will not call back and you cannot reach the dr through reception. 

Since Covid, the surgery has become abysmal and the level of care has dropped to substandard levels. The admin staff are awful and common sense working and patient care no longer seem to prevail here. It’s very sad. We are tired of all the issues and like many others are looking to move our family to another Drs surgery.

title: Good experience
body: I was seen on time and the practitioner who did the ultrasound was considerate and friendly .  I appreciated the large car park as it isn’t the easiest place to get to by public transport if you have mobility problems.  Buses can get you to within ten minutes walking distance if you don’t.

title: Compassion Fatigue?
body: In a lot of pain for over 2 hours. Could hardly walk or talk. Eventually, my daughter called 999 as pain was deteriorating and becoming unbearable. If I could have driven, then I would. Ambulance arrived and I felt very judged - 'you're only round the corner from the hospital' being one, jovial, comment. Walking to vehicle, doubled over, no help at all to steady myself - despite three paramedics present. Felt all boxes were ticked, but no compassion. Did not feel good and I have never felt so ill, or frightened, in my life. I support the NHS, but feel maybe some workers have compassion fatigue? I am in my 50s. If I had been elderly would it have been different? If the pain had been explicit ie bleeding limbs, would that have been different? At a time when you feel very vulnerable and in (unknown) excruciating agony, it felt uncomfortable to be treated like a wearying tick box. Very odd. I rarely use services, do not take them for granted, and work for NHS myself. This experience fell far short of what I would expect and what I would want my own patients to feel. Deciding to call 999 is a last resort, made by people who feel desperate, and in need of serious help, in one way or another. I was too ill to say anything at the time and too shocked. This was not the approach that is widely shown on heart warming tv documentaries! I felt like a time waster, even though it transpires I probably need surgery. Ambulance and A&E staff do a tremendous job - but they must never lose empathy for the patient's fear, pain and predicament in the few brief minutes they come into contact with them. Or condescend their pain and vulnerability. Being glib and treated as a job number, as opposed to caring for the individual presenting, is never acceptable.

title: Great experience
body: I attended on the first day of opening at the Oxford clinic. Everyone was super friendly and professional.  They also all had a fantastic sense of humour which was great. I am waiting for my cataract op but I have every confidence that it will be a good experience. Absolutely Everyone was great. Would thoroughly recommend.

title: Amazing care and teamwork
body: The staff on cedars ward really showed outstanding care and teamwork to turn my health around. Holistic care at its finest! As soon as I arrived on the ward I was looked at and immediately treated with care as an individual for my needs. Staff listened to me   , were warm and friendly. Thankyou each and every one of you!

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Unprofessional
body: I am writing this review because i am in pain and don’t want to call my Gp for help because of my unpleasant experience i had a phone conversation with the doctor i got a call back and try to explain my situation and the doctors don’t even check my medical records he said to me we can’t help you with this and said that if you need any proscriptions we can send you the nearest pharmacy I just feel so sad I have been taking about chronic diseases it’s affecting me overall my life he don’t even ask me anything about my situation i am really disappointed my previous Gp was amazing thanks

title: Wonderful practice
body: We are truly blessed to have this surgery - the doctors are absolutely brilliant but all staff (reception, dispensary, AHPs, phlebs, domestics) go above and beyond to help their patients.

title: Exceptional
body: I would like to express my gratitude to all the staff at St.Michael’s Hospital, Hayle. From the minute I arrived to leaving, every member of staff I encountered was kind, friendly and incredibly accommodating. I was on St.Joseph’s Ward. The staff should be very proud of the gold star service they are providing. Thank you.

title: Very understanding
body:
For years ever since being associated with the surgery, have I had the service with understanding that when one gets older some extra help is needed.
Since the diagnosis and years following with my wife ending up bedridden, I salute you and your staff, the greatest amount of respect. Is well in order, I thank you and your staff once more, regards Bob

title: Dignified and excellent care
body: My relative has been on Vic unit  for a number of weeks and has just been transfered to Southport. The care they received on the Vic unit was second to none. He was treated with respect, kindness and dignity. He had lots of encouragement during his stay. The units dedication and care has shone through what was an initial traumatic experience. Thank you all so much.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great standard of care
body: Afforded time, attention to detail, excellent response to various complex physiological issues arising.  Considerate to the potential psychological impacts - treated with compassion.

title: Competent staff
body: Attended A&E with a painful burn. Doctors and nurse very competent in decision making and management of burn. Very happy with my care.

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: New patient
body: My husband and I chose this surgery as it had great reviews from patients.We we’re given excellent support in the time we were with the doctor, he was excellent in listening and understanding us both, so much better than our other doctors we moved from, we’re now getting referrals to help with our health issues, something that hasn’t been looked at before.We we’re very impressed how efficient the doctor was and had time to make us feel so relaxed and comfortable and very satisfied with all the doctors help, and not forgetting the very pleasant receptionists which were really helpful with information too.Thankyou to all staff, nurses and doctors, keep up the good work.

title: this is a wonderful practice.
body:
I have received the very best care and attention , the GP`s are thoughtful and very efficient with managing the medical need .  I have been part of the surgery for many years and have always had my health threated as a priority at all times.  I am very grateful.
I thank my GP`s for being angels.

title: Brilliant from start to finish
body: This was our 3rd time for our son to have an operation. The children’s ward is fantastic, knowing what’s coming by the 3rd visit he likes it so much it’s like a day out. Everyone is so friendly and caring. The team down in theatre are second to non and they deserve the biggest praise of all, to see your child laughing, having fun and completely unaware before being put to sleep is so comforting. Everyone we have met on all 3 occasions have been brilliant and although it’s far from where we live, I don’t mind not using our local hospital as knowing how good the service is here I’m happy to return.

title: Excellent appointment
body: The doctor dealing with me listened, made me feel comfortable and asked questions which helped me to explain my concerns and symptoms. This is not what I normally experience from this practice.

title: Thorough care and great bed side manner
body: The nurse on the night shift L, and the Dr on the day shift W were quick to respond to my needs, really kind and educated in helping me get back to health. If it wasn’t for waiting for a Registrar for discharge, it wouldn’t been a faultless emergency stay

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent
body: I received nothing but kindness and consideration from the doctor and nurses during my appointment. The results of the treatment, at the moment, seem positive.

title: Friendly and efficient service
body: For someone who rarely uses a GP practice I have always found Patford House very professional, easy to use and welcoming. My recent age-related health check was booked with ease and an appropriate amount of pre and post appointment communication. Thank you to the Patford House team.

title: Excellent service when needed urgently
body: I called an hour before the surgery closed to explain that my son was having trouble breathing properly. I explained the symptoms to the receptionist. Unfortunately, as it was so late in the day, the surgery didn't have any appointments remaining. However, the receptionist listened to my concerns and spoke to the duty Dr. The Dr asked us to come straight in and saw us immediately. I was right to be concerned and the Dr was able to help us and provided medication to help his lungs without needing to send us to hospital and booked us in to return the next day, on a Saturday morning, to have his oxygen levels checked again. We're very grateful for the service we received and the way we were treated. Thank you so much.

title: Wonderful caring and kind staff
body: I went for day operation under GA at Gateway G, the staff from start to finish were lovely, explained everything really well. The theatre staff were incredibly calm and patient. The anesthesiologist made me very comfortable, even though I was anxious at first, he was lovely and put me at ease, even had me laughing. Unfortunately there were complications afterwards and ended up staying overnight. I can't thank the staff enough in recovery. The gentleman who took care of me was amazing and so caring. Then the staff and facilities on the surgical short stay ward was amazing. Can't thank the staff enough. The NHS are amazing!!!

title: good treatment
body: the nursing staff were very good and reassuring and the endoscopist was polite and explained everything and i felt safe in everyones hands.coffee and biscuits afterwards so no problems.

title: The best practice ever.
body: The receptionists r all very patient,helpful with great customer service. Putting you at ease with their gentle responses, never hurried or rushed on the phone n in person.

title: Very positive experiences
body: I have had several positive experiences of care from Addison Road Medical Practice in recent months.  I have been able to get appointments quickly, for both myself and my son.  I have seen three excellent GPs, who listened and made eye contact and generally made us felt cared-for (this has not always been my experience with GPs).  The staff on reception and who answer the phone are kind and polite and patient.  I know what pressure everyone in the NHS is under at the moment so I just wanted to say how impressed I have been.

title: Great service  from the doctor who saw me
body: Yes, I had to wait a while but the doctor who saw me was amazing.  He was professional and pleasant and explained everything really well.  Such a kind meticulous person.   I was left understanding what had happened, what to look for and who to go to if there was an ongoing issue.    I seriously had a real positive experience and I could hear and see other staff trying to maintain a high standard. I plan to send a direct email into the  hospital so that this  doctor  gets to know that he is doing good.   Thank you again

title: Fantastic service
body: Visited opthalmology today. Fantastic service. Opthalmology at Blackburn Hospital have been treating me for the past 2 years. I can honestly say that the treatment they have provided has been top quality. Great service and the nicest professional staff I have ever met. Thank you aii.

title: Efficient, Professional, Kind
body: Went in for my diabetic retinal screening. Absolutely efficient, informative and kind. As soon as I walked in, I was greeted and the entire procedure was clearly explained. Barely a wait and post care instructions immediately outlined. Light years beyond the care provided in America. Thank you!

title: Amazing service
body: I had a wonderful experience at Thorpe Road Surgery. From the booking, initial tests, advice and follow up it was seamless. The new portal made it easy for an appointment to be made and I was called back quickly by my doctor.

title: The Best
body: I have received nothing but the best service from the first phone call to the practice reception for an appointment first with a practice nurse then for a doctor appointment I have no problem in recommending this practice to any of my friends

title: Great surgery
body: I have been with the surgery over 22 yrs and with now 3 grown children I cannot fault the surgery. I have always had my needs met and quite swiftly at that and they have always been helpful to my queries and questions. I've always managed to get an appt also when needed.. I have been and still am extremely  happy with the service of this practice.

title: Good experience
body: I went to Patford House surgery today and was greeted by a friendly, cheerful and approachable receptionist.  The person conducting my health check was very friendly and cheerful too, and I felt very at ease during my appointment.

title: Amazing experience
body:
I attended Circle Hospital Reading yesterday for the removal of a benign wrist Lipoma. My total experience was beyond incredible. Once again all staff surpassed themselves in providing first class care in a warm, friendly manner. There was a calm, professional atmosphere throughout the facility and I feel so fortunate to be offered this centre via the nhs funding agreement in place. All of my dealings with various staff leading up to my surgery yesterday
have been completely efficient and nothing was left to chance. This is so reassuring and impressive for the patient.
Importantly, the building appears exceptionally clean and the menu I was offered within the Day Care unit was exceptional. My food was beautiful and I was offered frequent hot or cold drinks.

title: Superb Practice
body:
Contacted my own GP by email who arranged a suitable appointment with his colleague who specialises in dermatology. 
Very helpful consultation and I was referred appropriately.

title: Great all over
body:
Lovely staff, helpful and smiley. Very clean and nice reception area with soothing music and coffee for free.
My items were kept safe while I had my MRI scan.  I felt safe and well taken care of.

title: Great practice
body: All three doctors were lovely. They were very professional, very thorough, very considerate, very supportive and I felt that I was in good hands. It was a very pleasurable experience. Thank you!

title: Vascular surgery and pre and post operative care
body: My husband was admitted from Warrington General Hospital with a femoral aneurysm resulting in a deep vein thrombosis in his leg. The care he received on ward 53 was exceptional from consultants down to auxiliary staff both prior and after surgery . He underwent major surgery and was admitted to the intensive care unit, again receiving exceptional care from all the staff. I and my husband cannot thank all those involved in his care enough. He is now recovering slowly following a bypass of the artery and continues to receive excellent after care . Cannot praise the vascular unit enough

title: Urgent treatment centre
body: Myself and my husband attended this department as his leg had swollen. In all, having been triaged and been seen by the doctor it was a 3hrs which was acceptable. The doctor  thought it was probably a deep vein thrombosis and arranged for a scan to be undertaken at Warrington hospital the following morning. Very impressed by the staff, care and doctor who examined my husband and cant thank them enough

title: Great Admin staff, Nurses and Doctors
body: Many people complain about the service from their doctors but I have to say the staff at courtside provide a great service. When I was confused about my repeat prescription the admin staff were kind and helpful. The nurses are caring and thorougher.  The econsult process works really well in getting a response and managing the doctors time. Thank you to all in the practice.

title: Good practice
body:
Great service from the pharmacy and pharmacists.  Able to speak to a pharmacist in private.  

Able to get an appointment to see a GP and nurse and good service from both, and also office/reception staff.

title: Out standing
body: Exemplary care from everyone outstanding in every department. Efficient, compassionate and caring. This is the best hospital, even better than  Murrayfield (who are good) which I have used many times but Clatterbridge leaves them in the shade. Thank you all - Highly Recommend.

readBy.name: Wirral University Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Probably the best Doctors surgery in…
body:
Have moved and registered with many different surgeries over the years, and while it can sometimes take a while to get a face to face appointment (probably due to the sheer amount of patients they have) it is easy to get a phone appointment. 
The staff are great. From the reception to the nurses and doctors. It is also fairly easy to sort out appointments and prescriptions on the website.
Have finally managed to get a lot of my health issues managed so much better than with previous practices. Would absolutely recommend them to anyone in the area! Thanks!

title: Orthopaedic foot clinic
body: I came back to outpatient clinic on 24th February.i have been in a cast for over a week to try to help my toe wound heel but my foot was swelling up and toe was rubbing so today taken it off and had it re dressed told not to remove the dressing until I go back to clinic on the 3rd march.the wound is open a bit but still sore and throbbing.i am on strong pain relief to help me especially at night when it’s waking me up.the consultant has been fantastic and is looking after me well.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Very good practice
body: I completed an e-consultation form recently and had a call back from the doctor on the designated day. I found the doctor to be calm, friendly and helpful. She listened carefully and responded with great empathy and understanding. I feel confident she has suggested the best course of treatment for my health concern.

title: Excellent!
body: I feel compelled to write this review as this past week a receptionist on duty on the Monday morning shift was so extremely helpful and so understanding. The patient care is simply superb at Woosehill - from the lovely receptionists front of house to the GPs, all nursing staff and allied health professionals, administration staff...frankly - everyone at the surgery 'goes the extra mile' to help and care...always showing professionalism and understanding - whatever the needs. As mentioned before a few years ago; My Mother & Father were patients at the surgery and had been for many years too and the care (and to us as a family too) that they received and particularly prior to passing on was also so very much appreciated. Thank you!

title: Fabulous service
body:
Son in law came to A & E at an extremely busy time. Eventually he was given an 
x ray and was admitted onto a respiratory ward. Thank you to A & E for realising it was a serious illness and admitting him onto such a fabulous ward. Please let the dept know we are very grateful to them for the way they dealt with our son in law.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Another excellent visit
body: My wife was seen by doctor examined and bloods taken and home within two hours,other visits to A&E were just as brilliant in the past.i cant thank all staff enough,so helpful polite and careing.while siting waiting at times i just wish other people could just manage a smile and a thankyou to the brilliant staff,again well done all staff so much appriciated

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appalling.
body: Absolutely shocking. Currently finding it impossible to make an appointment. Phone just rings and rings, can't get through to anyone. They say there is an online portal but there are no appointments available on there. Even when I've been there in person there is an extremely long line, I have severe anxiety and Work full time, incredibly difficult for me to negotiate that. Feeling very hopeless, I desperately need to make a gp appointment. I am a uk taxpayer, I should be able to use the nhs which I am paying for. Disgraceful.

title: Sad and frustated
body: I have always gone to another hospital for emergencies but had heard Whittington was great, and closer to my house. I wish I hadn’t gone. I came in suspecting I had bronchitis for the second time as I couldn’t breathe properly and even in triage nothing was right. The nurse (male) wouldn’t let me speak and didn’t want to know what medicines I took (note that I’m diabetic). Later I was called for an Electrocardiogram and the nurse who was going to perform it was eating and talking to his colleagues, all with the curtains open. Then, he asked if I wanted to put on a hospital gown, but when I said no, he noticed I wasn’t wearing a bra and made me put on one anyways (I like to think they have seen patients naked before?). But the last drop was when he was about to do a blood test. I have constant blood tests as a diabetic person and told him my good arm is usually the left one as my veins (and my whole family’s) are hard to find. He ignored me and said it varies from who’s doing the test and went on to put the elastic band on my right arm (without even looking at the other one). He left the room (while having me with the band and my arm swelling, still talking to his colleagues) to get a needle, and when I asked him to please let me know when poking he laughed and asked if that’s not how they did it in other places. Finally, he pinched me and, surprise, no blood was coming out, as it always happens on my right arm. Then instead of taking the needle off he started moving it around and poking it in and out until I started having an anxiety attack and asked him to remove it as it was obviously not working. After that he left and someone came to listen to my chest and I tried to tell them I had used a bronchodilator before coming but he said it didn’t make a difference. Meaning, I left the hospital worse than I came in, with a bruise on my arm and terrible anxiety.

title: What has happened to Knebworth Surgery?
body:
I have been a patient of the surgery for the last 9 years. Virtually as soon as they moved the Practice to the new, purpose built building - I can't get appointments to see my Gp. I have spent several hours trying to get through to the Surgery - at 8am, as you have to if you need an appointment with a Gp - or even a prescribing Nurse. Then you still don't get one!
Either because "They've all been booked up, and no, I can't book you one for tomorrow! Sorry, you'll have to ring back at 8am tomorrow!"

Now, I am guessing that the real reason is that Knebworth Surgery - which now has a Waiting Room capacity for at least 50 patients (as opposed to Station Road's 15 if you were lucky!), is actually usually pretty much empty, - because there are only 2 part - time Gp'sworking there!

So, from the Station Road site's at least 4 or 5 Gp's - most of whom I believe were full time, it has shrank dramatically in the number of patients they are capable of seeing.
This, perhaps wouldn't be too bad - if the population of Knebworth and it's surrounding cachement area had dramatically shrunk. Unfortunately the complete opposite has happened - A huge new number of patients (all retirement age, and over) must have / be in the process of registering as new patients - from the new Residential Home in the High Street, from the other Residential Home on London Road, and all of the other new properties which are / are being proposed to be built in and around Knebworth!

I understand that the original Office Manager has now left the practice (probably had enough of being shouted at!), but 2 New "Management Consultants" have been appointed. I have just One question for them - "What are you actually doing?!
What I mean is basically Why does Knebworth Surgery only now have 2 part-time Gp's and virtually No Availability, whilst the erm, other part of the practice (and indeed rather strangely, where the Head of the Practice is based) have at least double the number of Gp's? They have a waiting room for ooh, at least 10 patients (or less), and the last time I was forced to get there for an appointment, which could not be booked by The Knebworth surgery, the actual Reception had been deliberately Boarded Up!
(I am sorry for saying this, but the place reminds me of those old Council Toilets which were boarded up to try and prevent Vandalism!)

Now I realise, and apologise to, some residents of Marymead, but there are several other Gp Surgeries in the same area - the closest I think is less than half a mile away. I am not suggesting that every patient who uses the surgery will have suitable transport to get them there - but actually neither have I, to make the far longer trip from Knebworth!

So,I would just like to ask (The head of the entire practice, and the new Managers - Why build a new building to be capable of receiving the number of patients who would desperately (read all the other reviews) love to be able to actually see a Gp or Nurse without needing to travel to MMead?

title: 11 hour wait at A&E
body: I was admitted to A&E with chest pain and a history of cardiac issues. Every staff member I met was lovely and cooperative but the wait time was atrocious. When I was booked in, the PA said the wait time was 6 hours. 6 hours later, it changed to 9.5 hours. It ended up being 11 hours until I was seen by a doctor to discuss my test results and be discharged. He mentioned a follow up appointment but didn't give any details so I had to chase up the heart clinic and my GP, which I don't believe is the standard procedure. Everyone is trying their best but clearly they're too underfunded and no one wants to be a doctor or nurse because of this.

title: Very poor experience with this practice
body: Tried for over a week to get an appointment at this prwctice, without success. They prefer you to book appointments using the app but there are never any appointments available so you have to phone at 8am. I tried calling at 8am every morning for a week and despite being near the front of the queue, they said all appointments were taken. Reception staff were apologetic, but their only advice was to go to a&e instead.

title: Inconsiderate Ambulance Service
body: I was in excruciating pain and I was home alone, after several calls to 111 then sent me an ambulance. The minute they arrived into my home they were more interested in playing with my puppy than even worrying about me. They asked if they could let him out of his pen which they did, I was lying on the sofa in agony whilst my puppy jumped and ran all over me. They gave me morphine and said they were going to wait 20 mins for it to kick in, in the meantime they continued to play with my puppy. They finally got me in the ambulance, made me sit on a chair for the journey even though they knew I was in so much pain with sciatica. They then moved me to a wheelchair- another horribly uncomfortable seat and left me in a long line of ambulance waiting patients. They showed no empathy or care, infact made me feel like I was being a nuisance

title: Unsafe.
body:
Attended A and E last Friday evening. A 19 hour wait ensued. Felt poorly with an emergency condition in which I was left. Not offered a bed. I was polite, quietly spoken as was my husband. Staff however by return were, struggling to cope and in my opinion the environment felt unsafe. Smell of ?Cannabis. Which was reported to security.  Homeless folk sleeping on seats. Police walking up and down people intoxicated with alcohol and substance misuse, appeared priority.i felt to prevent a breech of peace. 
When checking with the triage nurse after 19 hour wait, for what may have been a life changing occurrence for me. She told me that some had waited 24 hours. Again I was polite , quietly spoken and respectful in tone and manner. However I felt the nurse was very curt and I did not feel that my health was priority. This is a sad state, if the staff could have imagined how I had ended up at their door they may well have been empathetic.  The stress they are under I'm sure is far too much. 
I felt there were inconsistent approaches by the medical staff. It is very sad, because staff could not follow me up due to their shift ending and hand overs being given. 
Although I did feel staff worked hard, I felt that they did not keep safe priorities . I also feel managers really need to look further into what can be done with the locality of the social problems coming through the front doors as many were inappropriately using the NHS A and E. This should be stopped. If I did not require urgent treatment, I would have never turned up there. 
Thank you.

readBy.name: Liverpool University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Audio vestibular
body: Hi I came to an audio vestibular appoinment this week and I wasn’t impressed with the care I was given from a certain member of staff from the team,he refused to do the testing which was requested by a member of my care home staff for auditory processing disorder and usher syndrome,and I felt it should have been done and then we might have had the formal diagnosis.I have looked up treatment options online and it says about powerful hearing aids,cochlear implants,orientation and mobility training and I do have a visual impairment which I use a patch and a cane for and audiology tell me I have bad hearing loss

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Faultless experience
body: Call made on Friday afternoon for my poorly child, call answered immediately, duty Dr called back within 40 minutes, review by GP in surgery within an hour of initial call and medication dispensed. Caring communication and thorough review. As a secondary care physician I am well aware of the challenges on the service and I was enormously impressed with the responsiveness and attitude of all staff. Thank you.

title: Poor service
body:
Had some blood tests that showed low sodium levels. Got a text to inform me (not even a phone call) with no explanation of what to do about it.
Had more tests a week later (again via a brief uninformed text).
Still trying to figure out what is wrong with me and still no answers from my GP
Rang surgery only to be told to ring back at 8am and listen to the option.
No help from doctors yet 
It’s a disgrace and it’s time for the GPS to start working with people

title: Awful practice
body: I have an awful chest infection and require antibiotics, l have spent 8 days and a total of 6 hours on the phone trying to get an appointment to no avail, why is this surgery taking new patients on when they can't see the ones they have already got, disgusting service,

title: Disorganised admin.
body:
a couple of good doctors - when you can get an appointment. Typically 6week+ wait. This has been the case for many years, and getting worse with the same excuses. Why not pay for some locums?

Admin is the biggest let down in this surgery- GP had to request actions twice for me.
Reflected in attention to the front of house - almost
Every single wall space in reception is occupied by a leaflet, many duplicates, many peeling off the wall.  Which one is relevant?
- an “Out of order” notice next to lift: nothing given as to when a fix is due 
- a check in machine which doesn’t always work. It also has a confusing printed message on top , apparently if wanting a Doc, then don’t use it. Hard to see message as blends into all The other printed notices on the wall.

Clearly there is no site manager capable of looking at the surgery from a customer perspective - and patients are customers which is forgotten  

Time to get the paint brush out … both physically and metaphorically

title: Dreadful experience
body: I had very good experiences with all the providers in the centre until my last visit. There was a mix in the appointment system and the lady who dealt with me was obviously in a bad mood and did not want to see an extra patient. She only allowed about 10 seconds for the eye drops to work (they didn't) and hurt my right eye. I was in agony. It felt like a papercut across the eye. I left the clinic in tears. Disgraceful. I have asked to be referred to another provider.

title: Medical
body:
I ordered my repeat prescription 2 week ago and it was rejected, then I had phone call from surgery telling me it was too early. I explained they don't send me enough for 2 months. I have no metaformin left she said she will order with urgent request. After 3 day I went to surgery and found my perception still not signed by doctor. I was told that doctor is running surgery can not sign my perception. because doctor is not capable of doing to things at one time. 2 week's pasted I still have no medicine. Is it great surgery would say. Eventually I decided to move surgery to where doctor are
Capable of doing 2 things at time . Receptionist are not up to the job.

title: Living in fear
body: Since the start of Covid Covid has been used as an excuse not to see patients.  Nothing has changed and patients cannot get through the doors and are abandoned.  The only way to see a Doctor is to go private or suffer if patients cannot afford private treatment.  Why are Cancer patients seen as a threat or like someone with the plague. It's quite scary and nobody answers the phones or returns calls.  It's like living in a third world country with the non existent care

title: Terrible Service
body: I work an hour away so I am on the road when you have to call the surgery to book an appt, so it is inevitable that one is going to lose signal and have to keep calling back, however in general there are extremely long wait times on the phone and then all appts are gone. I had a appt with a physician who after call said she would arrange an appt with a doctor as the advise passed on by my own doctor was not acceptable. I received a iron infusion a while a go due to my body not absorbing iron and advised by consultant I would probably need another one in the future. Blood test last Nov showed very low levels of ferritin (though I was not advised till recent appt with physician) identifying I would need an infusion (if my file had been read) I receive a prescription for iron tablets. The Physician advised as my haemoglobin was ok maybe I didn't need an infusion, I advised her that it was ok last time, she checked and said oh yes.  I ask to go back on HRT and advise passed on from my doctor was no, you can go on an anti depressants !! just wow. I receive a text for telephone appt, I call and wait forever to advise the receptionist I was to have a face to face, you can't was the response, you have to be triaged first, I have I responded. I asked for the doctor to be emailed to advise as told by the physician, chased twice. Still nothing, my telephone appt is next week. Had an appt on the 10th for B12 told by receptionist I was a no show, I showed her my text showing the time of appt and she said, you were a no show. I said my appt is in 10 mins, no it was changed, I was not aware, no apology just blamed the nurse. I have been at this surgery since it was opened. Absolutely appalling service, the staff need customer service training and should remember that patients maybe in a vulnerable place and kindness and manners go a long way. I sent an email last year to the practice manager, no response. I asked that the practice manage call me last year, nothing, I asked to speak to her or an email address recently so I could let her know how I had been treated. You will have to make a complaint came the reply. So seeing the responses on here to say we are sorry, if you could contact the practice manager is laughable. I have even written to the Partners and still no response.. I appreciate that you are all under enormous amount of pressure, however there are things that you can do to make it better for your patients and your staff.

title: Gents toilets
body: Both gents toilets near main entrance were out of order 9:30am 25/02. No staff knew where any others were and there was nobody on reception. The signage directs you to the ones that were broken. I eventually found one in the restaurant; although the toilets were not shown on the sign. I am not supposed to be weight bearing on my knee, but ended up doing 2500 steps, searching for the toilets. Please improve signage

title: Disgusting treatment to patients and their…
body: My partner was transferred here 6 months ago and since being there I have been extremely concerned about his welfare. The staff seem to not care, they offer no support groups, no activities, no help at all. I tried talking to the doctors to express my concerns but nothing has got better, I'm still very concerned but it's very hard to talk to anyone who could help. They've taken so much from the both of us to the point we're seriously depressed. Would not recommend anyone going here

readBy.name: Essex Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appointment cancelled
body:
Booked an appointment during half-term so I don't have to take time off from work. Got a text just 45 mins before the appointment that it is cancelled. They booked another appointment without consulting if its suitable - it wasn't as I want to avoid taking time off from work. 
Later, I get another text saying your next week's appointment is also cancelled and they will book it later. This time no reason given. It was an important consultation appointment to decide my next prescription for a pre-existing health condition.
This has never happened before where two appointments have been cancelled in a matter of couple of hours. Disappointed, shocked and angry how patients are treated so badly. No thought and sensitivity for patients who work full-time.

The only saving grace in this place are the doctors and medical staff. Reception service is awful. The stress and anxiety starts even before you dial the number. For patients like me who work, its impossible to be online for 90+ mins to book an appointment. Have to reply on someone to book it. Terrible service. Something has to change for the sake of patients who are dependent on you.

title: Unprofessional & rude!
body: I begrudgingly (due to previous poor experiences) got sent here by 111 and from the moment I arrived the staff were abrupt and rude. Despite not being able to talk due to severe swelling in my throat and being dizzy and unsteady due to an infection my partner couldn’t stay with me which meant I was left in a room alone with the odd person popping In occasionally. When I couldn’t answer for my checking in form the nurse just said well pain is clearly a 10/10 and just applied her own score before giving me a chance to try and speak. Had I have not been so poorly I would have left straight away. A very poor service and next time I will put my foot down to go to st Mary’s instead.

title: atrocious
body: my husband recently had to wait 4 days for life-saving medication due to the sheer ineptitude of the staff at this surgery.  This is not the first time I have submitted a review about the shambles that is known as kempsey surgery.  I once went there for a blood test and the 'nurse' was interrogating me about my private life.  If the staff at this practise spent more time concerning themselves with the welfare of their patients and less time wanting to know the personal details of those who they are supposed to be caring for, perhaps it would be a halfway decent surgery.  In the end my husband had to complain to Kempsey Surgery's sister surgery (Haresfield) and one of the receptionists there sorted his medication out and finally  it was delivered.  The whole place needs a clear out and in my opinion, the staff need to be re-trained or some new staff brought in, preferably with people who know how to file the prescriptions under the correct initials.

title: Professional Care
body:
30 Dec diagnosedBowel Cancer At Kidderminster General Hospital.
Surgery , reconnection at Worcester Royal on 15. 3. 23 with planned stoma reconstruction soonest. Discharged 20.3.23
Every professional I met at both Hospitals were kind, caring and apparently solely dedicated to my well being.
I commend them all without reservation

The food at Worcester was universally accepted as being awful.

title: Quick, kind and efficient
body: On the advice of 111 I went to urgent care here - I had trodden in  something sharp, and was worried - correctly - that my foot was infected. The receptionist sent me immediately to speak to a nurse, who took a short history, offered  me pain relief, and referred me to the ‘pod’ where these injuries are treated. I was seen in 15 minutes, and my wound cleaned,  my foot x rayed, and I was on my way home within an hour and a half with a cleaned, dressed foot, antibiotics in my bag, a tetanus shot in my arm, and much less worry on my mind.  The surroundings there are  shabby but the care is anything but. It was excellent - efficient, kind and friendly. Thank you very much.

title: Poor care
body: I attended Honiton hospital with a swollen, red and extremely painful arm. It took nearly 2 hours to be seen. No doctor was available so I was seen by a nurse practitioner. She was convinced the arm was not infected - although the evidence pointed fairly obviously to infection. She refused to prescribe any form of anti infection - no antibiotic cream or tablets. 24 hours later, the infection had become severe and I had to attend a different A&E to find a doctor. This nurse should not be seeing cases that should be dealt with by a doctor. I don’t particularly blame her as the ‘hospital’ should be providing a doctor to see patients. I would not recommend wasting your time here.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust (2)

title: My prospective of my appointment
body:
Face to face appointments are almost always easier for me due to my specific health issues but getting one isn't at all easy. The best and quickest way to speak to a Dr is via Doctrin. 
In the most recent instance of needing to see a GP, a week after completing a course of antibiotics for a chest infection that had been diagnosed and prescribed by a Dr (on the phone) the day after I'd - as usual - contacted the surgery via Doctrin. My medical history was not known by the Dr who phoned me initially, nor, it appeared to me, was the fact I am a laryngectomee, although I made it clear in the information given by mr on the Doctrin form. I don't think she'd had time to read the form fully or look at my records. She also may not have treated a laryngectomee before.
My second approach via Doctrin was because, having completed the antibiotics and still having the infection,  I thought I required more help. The GP phoned the next morning and after our conversation, she offered me an appointment that day. I am sure seeing me for the first time, the GP found it easier to understand my problem and acted accordingly and I felt she was more aware of facts having seen me. 
 Being a laryngectomee means I breath through my neck and speak differently and if this is not known or understood by a GP who hasn't met/ spoken to me before, it causes me extra stress and I am sure must cause some to the GP.  I was far more confident seeing her than I had been with a telephone consultation. 
But if the initial telephone consultation had been with a GP who knew me and had treated me over the many years I have been a patient at the surgery, it would have been far better.

title: Painful service
body:
I appreciate the call handler and clinicians services... However a person calling in isn't ready for thoysa ds of questions

Especially answering g a yes or no to a symptom is like dismissing a symptom which is mildly there and accounts for a condition.

Again irrelevant data collecting information when someone's ill is not acceptable.

Also the concern was just whether or not I should continue my medication until the GP is back from weekend. But that was never answered.

The format and expertise at this service needs to be levelled up really quickly. It's painful to be on the phone for almost 2 hours and not getting any certain answer. I can understand the wait time and appreciate how busy it is. But if its mostly generic response or no response at all then one has wasted 2 hours of time for those who possibly may have had a bigger emergency.

Please increase expertise and efficiency.

title: Superb care
body: Went in for a colonoscopy, doctor, nurses and helpers all excellent in their approach, attention, care and attitude. Cannot recommend this department enough. Thank you to all staff

title: Would recommend
body: Had a scan at Healthshare Norwich. Terrific place - I was seen 10 minutes before my appointment time. Everything was extremely professional and spotlessly clean . Would highly recommend- 10 out of 10

title: Very Poor Service
body: On Friday February 17th, I tried to get a telephone return call as no appointments were available on the app, so I visited the surgery as I have a bad chest infection which firstly I tried to resolve by going to my local chemist. I was told by the receptionist that a message was left for a member of staff to call me back. It’s now Friday February 24th and still no one has called.what does one have to do to seek help? I have no issues at all with the receptionist, as she was helpful and Polite

title: Appalling experience.
body:
I suffer with Fibromyalgia, CFS, Insomnia, Chronic lower back pain, neck pain, knee and hip pain. While explaining how unhappy I am in life due to my quality of life, and that I believe there is something that hasn't been diagnosed causing the issue, the consultant asked me "why do you want a label for it?" Aside from the fact that that's why people come to hospitals, to be diagnosed and treated, I was insulted that my in-depth answers were taken and ignored. I was treated with no compassion or understanding and am still having to put up with daily debilitating chronic pain, lack of energy, and having little to no restorative sleep. His solution was a body reprogramming course for I weeks, reading online materials, and no  helpful medication or route to insomnia diagnosis and treatment. I can't be the best father to my 3yr old daughter, or the best partner to my woman, I barely shower or keep basic routines, and I can barely do any housework. I'm bedbound exhausted 14-18 hours a day with pain and no sleep, yet I'm expected to take up an 8 week course. Yet another specialist unit, another appointment, and yet again, I feel unlistened to, not taken seriously, and like I'm unable to get my life back. I hope others aren't in the same boat. Cognitive Behavioural Therapy, Gainful Excersize Therapy, Body Reprogramming. These are not helpful therapies, and has been proven time over. Nice guidelines even stopped suggesting them! I asked to be taken off of the duloxitine as it's being used off-label for pain management but it's effects aren't noticed by me - the person I saw ignored that too. Recent studies also show chronic pain users that are perscribed antidepressants for off label pain management, 71% of patients end up with dementia or other memory issues. I'm heavily disappointed in my experience, and want to be taken seriously but this appointment has been more of the same previous experiences I've had. 
I understand I have neuropathic pain, but I also have chronic back and neck pain that the gabapentin simply won't touch, or my damaged knees and hip, or my burning feet, or lactic acid build up in muscles from simply walking 50 meters.

title: Fast and friendly service
body: Had to visit Minor Injuries for an infected cat bite. I was in and out within about 20 minutes. What a brilliant service by our NHS and our hugely dedicated NHS staff. Many thanks for everything you do.

title: Booking system update denies patients access to…
body: Due to a system update, patients have been denied access to a non-urgent pre-bookable medical appointment for over 3 weeks and yet the practice seem to think this is acceptable and won't be challenged.

title: Community care
body:
After hearing my mother had not been eating well and a telephone call to confirm we could both visit her, I was asked to leave, ironically after helping  her to eat the whole of her main meal and pudding.
Different nurses consistently gave different information. And the rules were non sense.
Apparently you can visit individually but not together because of Covid. I had not realised it was only infectious in pairs!

title: Very good
body:
Reception  very helpful,  GP helpful @ informative. Overall good experience. 
Have been going to this practice for over 10 years and I've found it to have 
Improved significantly.

title: I felt neglected by most staff
body:
I have met a pair of absolutely amazing and helpful people one being nurse one being a doctor, however, I feel like them two were the only caring people in this practice.
I have called in tears as I was in massive pain caused by my condition begging for a face to face appointment as they have asked me to come in person to them whenever my condition reappears. Person picking up the phone just said you’ll get a call from us don’t know when. This wasn’t the first time either. Once person wouldn’t let me get even a call appointment as in their eyes it was pointless cause I wouldn’t be able to get meds from boots by myself. Then I have said that my partner will do it for me they then promised me a call back from a doctor which has never taken place. I do not recommend this practice.

title: Has always been fantastic bar one specific doctor…
body:
Went to Ramsbury Surgery on 23/02/23 for my mental health and chronic illness. 
The first doctor I saw (never visited this particular one before) appeared to have no care, compassion or empathy. Instead was rather rude, blunt and derogatory. I had called because of the pain I was in and my mental health has been awful to cope with. 
Read the follow up notes and was quite frankly, disgusted. That ‘I was very negative and didn’t want to help myself’!
Left feeling worse than when I went in.
Was so broken, I ended up seeing another Dr (have not seen before either) who was very understanding, caring and actually listened. 
Was more upset than before I went up there. 
This doctor also got me in with a mental health nurse straight after. 
If there was ‘nothing else that could’ve been done’, then why did the second doctor actually listen and manage to help me?

title: They do not care.
body: Was sent to A and E and accepted under medics by GP with epilepsy and a headache that pain relief did not work. Queued for an hour, was told I be triaged and given stronger medication. 3 hours later i was in triage nurse was rude and emotionless while i cried in pain stated I declined medication when I stated I been taken it for 5 days straight and it didn't work, my partner also expressed concern as I had multiple seizures in the waiting room. 9 hours for pain medication. My partner kept chasing it up no one knew nothing. Finally saw a lovely junior doctor who went above and beyond for me. Prescribed different medicine and when she came back she said she sorry I had to wait another 2 hours for it. She contacted all the necessary people and I was eventually allowed home.

title: Brilliant care
body: Attended for first time and was so pleased with the excellent, professional and competent service, through from the receptionist to the nurse and admin staff. The expertise and skill of the nurse who treated my wound was so calming and reassuring. It gave me and my wife confidence that the problem can be sorted which we didnt have previously. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Swift and professional service
body:
Rang to see if they could help with a referral a GP has made to Rotherham Hospital but not heard anything in a couple of months. The new option on the phone of being able to speak directly with the medical secretaries made the process easy.

Additionally they followed up straight away and rang me back within an hour stating what they had done which also did the trick as the hospital rang the same day and offered an appointment.

Fantastic service delivered in a very professional manner from the Secretary.

title: Amazing care
body:
Our son-in-law was admitted onto the respiratory ward from A & E. From the moment he was admitted onto the ward 
he was looked after by the most amazing respiratory and Haematology consultants. Tests were carried out every day and eventually a diagnosis was reached. The nursing staff also went above and beyond the call of duty in every way. As a family we would like to thank each and every one of you for the way you looked after our son-in-law and kept our daughter informed every step of the way and nothing was ever too much trouble We will never forget your kindness & dedication in a very stressful situation. We could not have had any better care. Thanks again to you all.

readBy.name: Wrightington, Wigan and Leigh NHS Trust

title: Disbelief
body: Absolutely missing target when providing care.Cannot follow up request to speak with a medic Thought all calls were recorded No professional rapport when answering calls on the phone lost any faith or trust shame on you

title: Terrible Service
body: Needed to see minor injuries unit due to worsening pain in arm 3 weeks after fall. The only time somebody even looked at my arm was to check blood pressure. All seemed rushed. Got a telephone appointment with a GP (which I am more than capable of doing myself) and they cannot refer me for a scan directly as my GP is in the borough of Newham so have to contact my own GP. Feels like a wasted journey and that it would have been easier if I could see someone face to face. I do not like going to hospitals for no reason and this is my first time attending minor injuries and I am very disappointed in the service.
